business.headline: Agents' body questions GST cut, says move undermines insurance distributionPrashant Mhatre, All India President of the General Insurance Agents Federation Integrated (GIAFI), has sounded an alarm, saying the decision risks weakening the role of agents, brokers, and advisors who are central to India's insurance reach.
Planning a personal loan? Don't make these 5 errorsWhile personal loans can be a handy financial tool, they come with risks if mismanaged. Avoid these five common errors to keep your finances safe.

Wintrack vs Chennai Customs is a sorry tale of grease of doing business in IndiaChennai-based logistics company Wintrack has ceased Indian operations, alleging repeated bribery demands and harassment by Chennai Customs, exposing the ugly truth that at Indian Customs integrity is the real contraband.

Delhi government may revise circle rates, public feedback invitedThe Delhi government is considering a revision of circle rates across the city and has called on the public to share their views before any changes are finalised.

Health insurance in 2025: Key traps that could drain your pocketClauses such as room rent caps, deductibles, and co-pay options are often buried deep in policy documents but can have a massive influence on the claim process.
Sensex, Nifty recover losses to end higher fuelled by gains in metal stocksThe S&P BSE Sensex added 223.86 points to close at 81,207.17, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 57.95 points to end at 24,894.25.

63% of households aware, yet only 9.5% invest in markets, Sebi survey showsDespite growing awareness about investing in the markets, the latest Sebi survey shows that only a small fraction of households, i.e., just 9.5%, are actively investing.

Looking for high returns? This small savings scheme beats PPF and NSCMany investors assume PPF or NSC offer the best returns, but the scheme leads the pack with the highest interest among small savings schemes. Have a look.

Wintrack vs Chennai Customs: If forced to bribe, can companies fight legally?The Finance Ministry has already ordered an official probe, but the matter has also raised a wider debate: if businesses are forced to pay bribes to get their consignments cleared, do they have the law on their side?

Will Zerodha end its zero-brokerage model for equity delivery trades?Zerodha, long known for offering free equity delivery trades, could soon charge for delivery trades for the first time, signalling a major shift for investors.

India can't be passive spectator: Nirmala Sitharaman talks tough amid US tariffsUnion Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman opened the Kautilya Economic Conclave 2025 in New Delhi, urging India to play a more active role in shaping global decisions amid growing economic and geopolitical uncertainty.

My Customs story floods X after Wintrack's explosive chargeAfter the Finance Ministry confirmed an official probe into Wintrack's charges, importers, customs brokers, and business owners across the country have started sharing their own accounts of harassment, bribery demands.
Sensex opens 205 points lower, Nifty below 24,800; Tata Steel up 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 208.31 points to 80,775.00, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 75 points to 24,760.80 as of 9:30 am.

WeWork India IPO opens for bidding: Should you subscribe? Check GMPFounded in 2016, WeWork India is a flexible workspace operator offering a wide range of solutions including co-working spaces, managed offices, enterprise office suites, private offices, and hybrid digital solutions.

OpenAI hits $500 billion mark as SoftBank, others buy shares: ReportThe latest valuation marks a sharp rise from the company's previous valuation of $300 billion and highlights how quickly OpenAI's value has grown as demand for artificial intelligence tools continues to rise.

Bribes and social media war: Import firm vs Chennai Customs over 'corruption'The controversy began on the social media platform X where Wintrack Inc, a Chennai-based import company, accused Chennai Customs of systemic corruption, saying that constant demands for bribes had forced it to shut down its operations.

Google layoffs: Over 100 design jobs cut in AI shiftGoogle has also been cutting back on management layers. According to reports, the company has reduced the number of middle managers by more than a third, particularly those overseeing small teams.

Market holiday: Are NSE, BSE open on Gandhi Jayanti, Dussehra on October 2?Sensex and Nifty gained nearly 1% in the last session after the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) kept the repo rate unchanged at 5.5% and maintained its neutral stance.

Satya Nadella bets big on AI, names Judson Althoff to lead Microsoft commercial unitMicrosoft has elevated Chief Commercial Officer Judson Althoff as CEO of its commercial business, allowing Satya Nadella to focus on AI, datacenter buildout, and product innovation.
Why the price of gold keeps breaking recordsBullion has soared more than 45% this year, putting it on track for the biggest annual gain since 1979.

Adar Poonawalla in talks to buy RCB stake? United Spirits shares updateThe CEO of Serum Institute, Adar Poonawalla, is in talks with Diageo to purchase a stake in RCB, one of the Indian Premier League's top teams.
Are festive cheer and auto stocks driving the market rally?The stock market showed renewed strength, as festive season cheer and gains in auto stocks lifted investor sentiment across sectors.

DA hiked to 58%: What it means for government employees' salary and pensionThe Union Cabinet approved the proposal to increase the DA for central government employees and Dearness Relief (DR) for pensioners by 3%. With this revision, the DA rate now stands at 58%.
Sensex ends 716 points higher, Nifty above 24,800; Tata Motors up 5%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 715.64 points to end at 80,983.31, while the NSE Nifty50 added 225.20 points to close at 24,836.30.

This Indian gold lender holds 3 times the gold of PakistanThe country's largest gold loan provider, currently holds 209 tonnes of gold in its safe deposit boxes. This is three times the gold reserves of Pakistan and higher than the reserves of Brazil, Australia, and South Africa.

Shah Rukh Khan joins billionaire club, Mukesh Ambani tops Hurun India Rich ListMukesh Ambani has reclaimed the top spot on the Hurun India Rich List 2025, while Bollywood superstar Shah Rukh Khan joins the billionaire club for the first time.

Sensex jumps 500 points: 3 reasons why markets are rising todayThe S&P BSE Sensex surged 660.64 points to 80,928.26, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 185.70 points to 24,796.80 as of 12:10 PM. The rally was broad-based on Dalal Street.

Union Cabinet approves 3% DA hike for central government employeesEarlier this year, the government had approved a 2% increase in DA in March, raising it from 53% to 55% of the basic salary and pension.

RBI announces big push for business reforms and easier lending. Details hereThe Reserve Bank of India has unveiled a set of measures aimed at making it easier for businesses to operate and improving access to loans. The reforms are expected to help companies, exporters, and banks alike.

RBI holds repo rate at 5.5%: How it impacts your EMIsBy keeping the repo rate unchanged at 5.5%, the RBI has signalled stability for borrowers. Home loan EMIs are likely to stay where they are, offering some relief to existing and new buyers.

RBI holds lending rate steady at 5.5%, maintains neutral stanceThe Reserve Bank of India (RBI) kept the key repo rate unchanged at 5.5% as the Monetary Policy Committee (MPC), led by Governor Sanjay Malhotra, concluded its three-day meeting. The central bank also maintained its neutral stance.

LG Electronics India IPO opens next week: 5 key details investors must knowLG Electronics is set to launch the third-largest IPO of 2025, after Tata Capital's Rs 15,500 crore issue scheduled between October 6 and October 8, and HDB Financial Services, which raised Rs 12,500 crore in June this year.
Sensex opens nearly 100 points higher, Nifty above 24,500; Sun Pharma up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 58.51 points to 80,326.13, while the NSE NIfty50 added 25.65 points to 24,636.75 as of 9:24 am.

RBI MPC decision today: Will there be a surprise rate cut?India has seen supportive fiscal measures this year, including changes in income tax slabs and GST cuts, which are expected to boost consumption during the festive season.

Government keeps PPF, NSC and other small savings rates unchanged. Check hereThe government has kept interest rates unchanged for key small savings schemes, including PPF and NSC, for the upcoming quarter.

LG Electronics India's Rs 15,000 crore IPO to open on October 7. Check detailsThe much-anticipated IPO of LG Electronics India, worth Rs 15,000 crore, is scheduled to open on October 7. Here's everything you need to know.

Behind the buffet: How restaurants profit from all-you-can-eat deals'All you can eat.' That is how buffets work. But then how do famous buffets such as BBQ Nation, The GT Road, and Pirates of Grill, with prices ranging from Rs 900-1400, make a profit serving unlimited food?

Gold and silver lead the way as investors seek stability, says expertWith stock market volatility unsettling investors, many are turning to gold and silver for safety. Experts say the renewed interest in precious metals reflects a broader search for stability amid uncertain conditions.
Sensex, Nifty fall for 8th day in a row ahead of RBI MPC decisionThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 97.32 points to close at 80,267.62, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 23.80 points to end at 24,611.10.

Why staying consistent matters more than timing the market, says expertWhile market swings grab attention, experts insist that consistent investing, rather than trying to predict peaks and dips, is what helps investors achieve reliable growth over time.

entertainment.headline: Sunny Sanskari box office Day 2: Varun, Janhvi rom-com faces Kantara Chapter 1 clash Varun Dhawan's 'Sunny Sanskari Ki Tulsi Kumari' earned Rs 9.25 crore on Day 1 and Rs 5.25 crore on Day 2, bringing its total to Rs 14.50 crore. However, the rom-com struggled against Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara: Chapter 1'.

Vijay Deverakonda, Rashmika Mandanna are engaged, wedding in February: Reports Actors Vijay Deverakonda and Rashmika Mandanna got engaged in a private ceremony attended only by family members, according to reports. Their wedding is reportedly set for February 2026.

Ram Gopal Varma praises Kantara: Chapter 1, says all filmmakers should feel ashamed Actor-director Rishab Shetty's Kantara Chapter 1, a prequel to the 2022 hit, released in theatres on October 2. Ram Gopal Varma praised the film for its sound design, production quality and "unimaginable efforts."

SRK's National Award win for Jawan was predicted by Atlee, recalls Sanya Malhotra Actor Sanya Malhotra recently stated that director Atlee predicted Shah Rukh Khan's National Award win during 'Jawan' shoot. The film also featured Deepika Padukone, Nayanthara, Vijay Sethupathi and others in key roles.

Rishab Shetty wanted Diljit Dosanjh for Kantara but hilariously forgot his name Actor-director Rishab Shetty spoke about his experience of working with Diljit Dosanjh. Their collaboration on the 'Rebel' song marks a significant collaboration on 'Kantara Chapter 1'.

What did Hrithik Roshan say about War 2 shoot in his latest cryptic note? Actor Hrithik Roshan opened up for the first time ever since his action-thriller 'War 2' opened to mixed reviews and had a lukewarm box office response. He expressed gratitude to director Ayan Mukerji in his cryptic post, adding that "every film doesn't have to be a torture".

Malvika Raaj, Pranav Bagga announce their daughter's name with dreamy photos Actor Malvika Raaj and her husband Pranav Bagga revealed their daughter's name on Friday. The couple shared the news and first photos of their daughter on Instagram a day after Dussehra.

Satyameva Jayate: Rhea Chakraborty emotional on getting passport, friends react Actor Rhea Chakraborty wrote an emotional social media post after getting her passport back. Bombay High Court had earlier permitted Chakraborty to retain her passport, easing bail restrictions.

I lost my way: Rapper Diddy begs for mercy ahead of sentence in sex assault case Rappy Sean Diddy Combs begged for leniency ahead of his sentencing. In his letter, Diddy confessed to losing his way and how he will always carry the burden of domestic violence.

Deepak Chahar's sister Malti to join Bigg Boss 19 as wildcard: Reports Actor Malti Chahar is reportedly set to join 'Bigg Boss 19' as a wildcard contestant. She is the sister of cricketer Deepak Chahar. If she joins the Salman Khan-hosted show, she'd become the second wildcard entry of the season.

Kajol hugs Saif Ali Khan as he recounts stabbing incident in Two Much promo. Watch Saif Ali Khan and Akshay Kumar are all set to grace the latest episode of Kajol and Twinkle's chat show 'Two Much'. During the promo, Saif recalled the incident when he was stabbed on the neck.

Was Alia Bhatt first offered Sunny Sanskari? Director Shashank Khaitan replies Director Shashank Khaitan's 'Sunny Sanskari Ki Tulsi Kumari' released on October 1. He firmly denies it was ever part of the 'Dulhania' franchise and clears the air on Alia Bhatt being offered the film.

Vishal Jethwa of 'Homebound' is the rising actor we should be talking about With his stupendous acting in 'Homebound', Vishal Jethwa is quietly rewriting the rulebook of Bollywood newcomers. Doubt us? Read to find out how.

Bigg Boss 19 slips to 20th spot 'Bigg Boss 19' has fallen to twentieth position on the TV ratings chart after previously ranking eleventh last week. This shift highlights changing viewer preferences and the sustained dominance of leading Star Plus shows.

Boney Kapoor says Khushi got 100% scholarship from New York Film Academy Film producer Boney Kapoor recently shared that his actor-daughter Khushi Kapoor secured a 100% scholarship to the New York Film Academy. He said Khushi secured the scholarship based on her audition tape.

Why OTT reminds of Doordarshan of the eighties and nineties (and in a good way) In recent years, streaming platforms have emerged as launchpads for actors young and old who were struggling for a break in films, much like Doordarshan in the eighties and nineties. IndiaToday.in analyses the parallels.

Yash, Upendra praise Rishab Shetty's Kantara: Chapter 1 for raising the bar Rishab Shetty's Kantara Chapter 1 was released on October 3, 2025. Actor Yash praised the film in his X review called it a "truly immersive experience on screen."

Hometown Cha-Cha-Cha is the cosy K-drama you will never get over In this week's K-fix we discover why 'Hometown Cha-Cha-Cha' is the ultimate feel-good K-drama, from its seaside charm to heartwarming characters and cosy, healing storytelling.

Daughter was asked for nudes during video game: Akshay Kumar recalls cyber horror Akshay Kumar has recalled an incident when his daughter was asked to send nude photos while playing video game a few months back. He urged mandatory cyber period in schools at a recent event.

general news.headline: PM Modi praises Trump as Hamas agrees to free hostages: Significant step forwardPM Modi said the move marked "decisive progress" and reaffirmed India's support for all efforts towards a durable and just peace in the Middle East.

Stop bombing Gaza, Trump tells Israel as Hamas signals readiness for peaceTrump urged Israel to halt Gaza bombings after Hamas signaled readiness for peace, partially accepting his plan and offering to release hostages while ceding governance to technocrats.

Vijay Deverakonda, Rashmika Mandanna are engaged, wedding in February: ReportsActors Vijay Deverakonda and Rashmika Mandanna got engaged in a private ceremony attended only by family members, according to reports. Their wedding is reportedly set for February 2026.

Sean 'Diddy' Combs gets 4 years and 2 months in prison as judge cites abuse of womenSean 'Diddy' Combs was sentenced to 4 years and 2 months for arranging drug-fueled sexual encounters. He also expressed remorse, apologised for his actions, and acknowledged the harm caused to his victims.

Pakistan sells its soul as Trump grabs the landAs multinationals stampede for the exits, Pakistan has discovered it can't sell itself as a market anymore. Only its soil is worth buying, and Trump just became the biggest landlord of all.

Hamas agrees to free Israeli hostages after Trump's ultimatum on Gaza peace planHamas has agreed in principle to release Israeli hostages under US President Donald Trump's peace plan, signalling the first major opening in negotiations to end the Gaza war.

What are DEG and EG, the cough syrup contaminants linked to child deaths in MP?Recent child deaths in Madhya Pradesh and Rajasthan raised concerns over cough syrup safety. Health authorities found no toxic contaminants, but experts warn against irrational syrup use in young children.

Meet Arun Subramanian, judge who sentenced Sean 'Diddy' Combs to 4 years in jailJudge Arun Subramanian, the first South Asian on Manhattan's federal bench, sentenced Sean "Diddy" Combs, earning recognition for his calm authority, immigrant-rooted journey, and balanced, reform-minded approach to justice.

Virat Kohli and Usain Bolt in relay? Olympic legend reveals his dream teamUsain Bolt said that Virat Kohli would be part of his dream relay team of cricketers. The sprinting legend said that he would have been a cricketer if he wasn't a track and field athlete.
Learn How Adobe Express Is Making Graphic Design Fun In ClassroomsThe Adobe Express app is available on any smart device or desktop computer.
Row over Balasaheb's will reignites after Shinde Sena leader's fingerprints claimRamdas Kadam, who belongs to Eknath Shinde's MLA, alleged posthumous use of Bal Thackeray's fingerprints on his will.

Everybody will be treated fairly: Trump after Hamas agrees to his Gaza peace planHamas has agreed to release all Israeli hostages and engage in talks under President Trump's Gaza framework, while leaving key issues, including disarmament and Israeli withdrawal, subject to further negotiation.

Feeling at home: KL Rahul reflects on mental switch after Ahmedabad Test tonKL Rahul ended an eight-year wait for a home Test century with a composed 100 in Ahmedabad, reflecting on his mental switch in batting approach that finally made him feel at ease in Indian conditions again.

1st Test: Rahul, Jurel and Jadeja centuries bury toothless West IndiesIndia vs West Indies, 1st Test: KL Rahul, Dhruv Jurel and Ravindra Jadeja hit hundreds as West Indies paid the price for not being proactive on the field. India reached Stumps on Friday at 448 for 5, leading the visitors by 286 runs in the first innings.

Wintrack vs Chennai Customs is a sorry tale of grease of doing business in IndiaChennai-based logistics company Wintrack has ceased Indian operations, alleging repeated bribery demands and harassment by Chennai Customs, exposing the ugly truth that at Indian Customs integrity is the real contraband.

Russian woman in Bengaluru lists 10 Indian office habits considered unusual abroadA Russian woman working in Bengaluru for 12 years shares her observations on Indian office culture, and how it differs from abroad. In her post, she talks about unique workplace customs and the strong bonds formed over time.

Pakistan Army is a mercenary force, once butchered 25,000 PalestiniansFrom the 1970 Black September in Jordan when Pakistani troops under Zia-Ul-Haq's command butchered 25,000 Palestinians, to the brand-new defence pact with Riyadh, Pakistan's generals have long fought for whoever signs the biggest cheques. The latest deal with Saudi Arabia, with a promise of a nuclear shield, is the latest chapter in Rawalpindi's long mercenary ledger.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

World reacts to Hamas agreeing to release hostages under Trump's Gaza peace planThe world offered cautious responses on Friday after Hamas declared it was ready to release hostages and accept parts of President Donald Trump's Gaza peace plan.

Assam Chief Minister announces Judicial Commission to probe Zubeen Garg's deathZubeen, 52, was in Singapore to attend a cultural festival when he drowned after reportedly swimming during a yacht party on September 19.

Mother denies Kurkure, 8-year-old boy calls cops in Madhya Pradesh, video goes viralA boy from Singrauli, Madhya Pradesh, dialed 112 after his mother denied him Rs 20 for Kurkure and beat him. The viral video shows police consoling the child and later buying him Kurkure.

Grammy winner Tyla to make her India debut in MumbaiKnown for her hit single Water and energetic performances, Tyla will headline the festival, which also features Lil Yachty, Charlotte de Witte, and Alok. The Mumbai edition is expected to draw over 60,000 attendees.

US treasury considers $1 coin featuring Trump for America's 250th anniversaryThe US Treasury is considering making a $1 coin featuring President Donald Trump to commemorate 250 years since the declaration of American independence in 2026.

Stray dogs bite foreign coaches at World Para Athletics Championships in DelhiTwo coaches from Kenya and Japan were bitten by stray dogs in separate incidents at the World Para Athletics Championships in Delhi. Both received hospital treatment and are out of danger, as organisers scrambled to reinforce safety measures at the venue.

sports.headline: AFG vs BAN: Rashid Khan rattles Bangladesh, but Nurul, Rishad seal tense chase Bangladesh managed to pull through after a dramatic middle-order collapse caused by Rashid Khan to take the lead in the three-match series against Afghanistan.

Renuka Singh to return against Pakistan? Saba Karim opens up on India's key pacer Former wicketkeeper Saba Karim suggested India might bring back Renuka Singh for Sunday's Women's World Cup clash against Pakistan, with young Kranti Gaud potentially making way.

Stray dogs bite foreign coaches at World Para Athletics Championships in Delhi Two coaches from Kenya and Japan were bitten by stray dogs in separate incidents at the World Para Athletics Championships in Delhi. Both received hospital treatment and are out of danger, as organisers scrambled to reinforce safety measures at the venue.

Sri Lanka sorted out mistakes of India clash, ready to face Australia: Chamari Athapaththu Women's World Cup, SLW vs AUSW: Sri Lankan skipper Chamari Athapaththu said that her team has learned from the mistakes in the Indian game and is ready to face Australia in Colombo.

IND-A vs AUS-A: Tilak Varma's gritty 94 in vain as Australia level series Tilak Varma's gritty knock went in vain as Australia-A levelled the series with a thumping 9-wicket win over India-A on Friday, October 3. Tilak scored 94 runs as the Aussies won the rain-affected game with ease.

Shashank Singh dreams of India cap after IPL rise: I am close, knocking on the door In an exclusive interview with Sports Today, Shashank Singh said he remains focused on achieving his dream of playing for India and reflected on how the IPL has shaped his career, sharing insights into his journey with Punjab Kings and the lessons he's learned along the way.

Usain Bolt's cricket connection: Would have been a cricketer if not for sprinting Usain Bolt said, in an exclusive interaction with India Today, that he would have been a cricketer if he hadn't taken up sprinting. Bolt spoke about his experience being in India and much more during the interaction.

Virat Kohli and Usain Bolt in relay? Olympic legend reveals his dream team Usain Bolt said that Virat Kohli would be part of his dream relay team of cricketers. The sprinting legend said that he would have been a cricketer if he wasn't a track and field athlete.

Laura Wolvaardt vows to bounce back after nightmare 69 vs England Women's World Cup: South Africa captain Laura Wolvaardt said that the Proteas will look to bounce back after their 10-wicket defeat to England in Guwahati on October 3.

I was under pressure after India series, admits Linsey Smith Women's World Cup: Linsey Smith admitted that she was under pressure after she took only one wicket from three wickets. On Friday, Smith won the Player of the Match award in England's 10-wicket win over South Africa in Guwahati.

Women's World Cup: Australia wary of Sri Lanka's spin threat, says Litchfield Australia batter Phoebe Litchfield has said that they're wary of Sri Lanka's spin threat ahead of their clash in the Women's World Cup 2025 on Saturday, October 4. Sri Lankan spinners troubled India during the opening match of the tournament.

Sri Lankan spinners troubled India during the opening match of the tournament.

Linsey Smith after wrecking South Africa in Guwahati: Opening the bowling suits meWomen's World Cup 2025: England spinner Linsey Smith took 3 wickets for 7 runs to help bowl out South Africa for 69 and guide England to a 10-wicket win in Guwahati.

Snake grabs spotlight at India women's training before Pakistan gameIndia's training ahead of their Women's World Cup clash against Pakistan saw an unusual interruption when a harmless rat snake appeared at the R Premadasa Stadium, briefly sparking amusement.

Ready for battle: Good soldier Dhruv Jurel shows why he deserves India Test spotBeing a good soldier for his side, Dhruv Jurel has made sure he is always battle ready for his team when the opportunity is presented to him. Now, with his hundred in Ahmedabad, Jurel has staked his claim to be in the Indian team as a pure batter.

Privilege to even be in India Test squad, not focused on place in XI: Dhruv JurelIND vs WI: India wicketkeeper-batter and Ahmedabad Test century hero Dhruv Jurel emphasised that he considers getting a spot inj the India Test squad as a privilege in itself, and emphasised that he is not simply focused on getting a spot in the Playing XI.

Vidarbha in command vs Rest of India after Yash Thakur 4-wicket haulVidarbha are firmly in control of the Irani Cup clash against Rest of India, holding a commanding 224-run lead after bowling out their opponents for 214 in the first innings.

Captain Laura Wolvaardt urged her team to forget the defeat quickly and bounce back against New Zealand.

Captain Laura Wolvaardt urged her team to forget the defeat quickly and bounce back against New Zealand.

Kohli, Rohit likely for Australia tour; squads to be picked on October 4: ReportVirat Kohli and Rohit Sharma are likely to be part of the ODI squad for the upcoming Australia tour. The selectors are set to sitdown on Saturday, October 4 for selecting the squads for the upcoming tours with some key decisions set to be made.

Best ball of the Women's World Cup? Malinga hails Marufa Akter's beauty vs PakistanBangladesh pacer Marufa Akter stole the spotlight in the Women's World Cup 2025, claiming key early wickets against Pakistan and earning praise from legends Lasith Malinga and Mithali Raj.

After Rahul Dravid's exit, RR continue revamp as bowling coach exits: ReportFollowing Rahul Dravid's exit, Rajasthan Royals have initiated sweeping changes, with Sairaj Bahutule and Dishant Yagnik set to leave the franchise. RR finished 9th on the points table last season in the IPL.

England make a mockery of South Africa in Guwahati to become table toppersFour-time champions England began their Women's World Cup campaign in style, dismantling South Africa for 69 and cruising to a 10-wicket win with 215 balls to spare. The victory, England's third-biggest in World Cup history by balls remaining,

Fifty celebration for dad, hundred for army: Jurel after Ahmedabad centuryDhruv Jurel revealed that he dedicated his maiden Test hundred to the Indian army after he pulled off a unique celebration after reaching the landmark. Jurel helped India maintain control over West Indies on Day 2 of the Ahmedabad Test.

1st Test: Rahul, Jurel and Jadeja centuries bury toothless West IndiesIndia vs West Indies, 1st Test: KL Rahul, Dhruv Jurel and Ravindra Jadeja hit hundreds as West Indies paid the price for not being proactive on the field. India reached Stumps on Friday at 448 for 5, leading the visitors by 286 runs in the first innings.

Was for my daughter: Rahul explains new hundred celebration during 1st TestKL Rahul revealed that his new celebration was dedicated to his daughter after getting a well-made hundred during the Ahmedabad Test against West Indies. Rahul continued his fine run with the bat with his hundred.

Dhruv Jurel strengthened claim for pure batter spot with century vs WI: Parthiv PatelFormer India wicketkeeper Parthiv Patel lauded Dhruv Jurel's maiden Test century against West Indies. He said the 125-run innings strengthens Jurel's case for a regular spot as a specialist batter in India's Test XI.

Watch: Dhruv Jurel's guard of honour tribute for armyman father after maiden Test tonDhruv Jurel scored his maiden Test hundred against West Indies in Ahmedabad on Friday. His emotional guard-of-honour salute paid tribute to his father, a retired army Havildar, who fought in the Kargil War.

Ravindra Jadeja emulates Kapil Dev, Imran Khan with sixth Test hundredRavindra Jadeja joined the legendary duo of Kapil Dev and Imran Khan after racking up his sixth ODI hundred in the opening Test against the West Indies at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad.

Dhruv Jurel hits first Test century vs WI, auditions for specialist batter roleDhruv Jurel strengthened his claim for a regular India Test spot with a composed maiden century against West Indies. His 190-ball effort showcased his skill, temperament, and ability to perform as a top or middle-order batter.

Playing into hands of India: West Indies slammed for delaying 2nd new ballWest Indies' decision to delay the use of the second new ball was slammed by Abhishek Nayar, Aakash Chopra and Daren Ganga, who questioned the mentality of the visitors during the Ahmedabad Test.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
